title: MPC 0.8, investment increase of $1 multiplied by 5

content.question: In an economy with lump-sum taxes and no international trade, if the marginal propensity to consume is 0.8, which of the following is true?

choices.label: When consumption increases by $5, investment increases by a maximum of $1.
When consumption increases by $5, savings increase by a maximum of $1.
When investment increases by $1, income increases by a maximum of $5.
When investment increases by $1, consumption increases by a maximum of $5.
When income increases by $1, investment increases by a maximum of $5.

content.answer: When investment increases by $1, income increases by a maximum of $5.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
